keyTakeAways: Trump administration officials are privately discussing a potential meeting between President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un during Trump’s upcoming Asia trip.

There has been no formal logistical planning or communication between Washington and Pyongyang since Trump’s first term, and North Korea previously rejected a letter of invitation from Trump in early 2025.
The White House has prioritized meetings with Chinese leader Xi Jinping over a North Korea summit due to escalating US-China trade tensions.
Trump expressed interest in meeting Kim after a meeting with South Korean President Lee Jae-myung in August, who suggested the APEC gathering in South Korea could be a setting for such a meeting.

Kim Jong Un previously expressed openness to a meeting, stating in a speech before the North Korean parliament that he has good memories of Trump and welcomes peaceful coexistence if the US drops its obsession with denuclearization.
The 2019 Panmunjom summit, where Trump stepped into North Korea and shook hands with Kim, was arranged hastily after a tweet and involved no prior formal communication or planning.
A 2019-style rapid response mechanism (including a US-North Korea hotline and a bullhorn at the DMZ) was activated after Trump’s tweet, but no immediate response from North Korea was received.
North Korea’s team cleaned their side of the DMZ and later responded through the hotline, signaling agreement to a meeting that occurred on the day of Trump's arrival.
Trump took 20 steps into North Korea, becoming the first US president to set foot in the country, and the two leaders shook hands for about an hour.
Despite the high-profile nature of the handshake, no substantive agreement was reached, and there is currently no ongoing communication between South and North Korea about a summit.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Trump administration officials are quietly considering a potential summit between President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un during Trump’s upcoming Asia trip. Although no formal planning or communication has occurred since Trump's first term, both leaders have previously expressed openness to meeting — with Kim noting favorable memories of Trump and Trump expressing interest after a meeting with South Korean President Lee Jae-myung. A 2019-style rapid diplomatic response, including a tweet, hotline calls, and a bullhorn at the DMZ, was used to initiate contact, and North Korea eventually responded by cleaning their side of the DMZ and agreeing to a meeting. The two leaders met at the Panmunjom border, where Trump became the first U.S. president to step into North Korea, shaking hands for about an hour. However, no substantive agreements were reached, and the White House has prioritized talks with China over North Korea due to rising trade tensions. South Korea currently has no ongoing diplomatic communication with North Korea about a summit, and no plans exist to repeat the 2019 meeting.
title: Trump officials quietly discussing Kim Jong Un meeting during upcoming Asia trip
